Legal_Issue: Whether the RPD unreasonably concluded that the applicants failed to prove the unavailability of state protection in Mexico
Application_Facts: The applicants claimed fear of local criminals but never reported incidents to police
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the RPD's decision
Court_Ruling: The court dismissed the application for judicial review, upholding the RPD's decision
Claimant_Status: Applicants seeking refugee status and protection
Grounds_for_Claim: Fear of persecution by non-state actors (criminals) in Mexico
Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard: justification, transparency, and intelligibility
Procedural_Issue: Judicial review of a Refugee Protection Division decision
Credibility_Assessment: RPD found no nexus to s. 96 grounds; applicants did not demonstrate risk in seeking police help
Evidence_Used: Applicants' claims of threats from criminals
Legal_Provision_Cited: Section 96 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Application_Basis: Claim of lack of state protection in Mexico
Evidence_Assessed: Failure to report incidents to authorities
No evidence that seeking police protection would result in harm
Relief_Sought: Recognition as refugees and protection under Canadian law
Governing_Rule: RPD's decision must be reasonable, transparent, and justifiable
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Applicants did not provide evidence explaining why state protection was unavailable or why accessing police would be dangerous
Harm_Assessment: Alleged threats from local criminals in Mexico
Cause_Description: The family fled Mexico after alleged threats from criminals, claiming lack of state protection
Evidence_Handling: RPD assessed credibility and sufficiency of evidence regarding state protection
Evidence_Issues: Lack of corroboration or explanation for non-engagement with state authorities
Legal_Provision: Section 96, Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evidence_Assessment: Applicants failed to meet burden of proof regarding unavailability of state protection
Decision_Rationale: No nexus to protected grounds; state protection available; applicants did not show risk in accessing police
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient evidence to establish inability to access state protection
